devdoc.author: Giuseppe La Vecchia

Initialized(uint8).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

params.isModify: if true, it means that the caller of this function want to change something in a City. Otherwise it is an addition operation.
if true, it means that the caller of this function want to change something in a State. Otherwise it is an addition operation.

params.cityAddr: address of that city that you want to return

params.ptContractAddress: the contract address of the PollutionToken contract, used by this contract.

devdoc.title: A contract to be used by Admin(deployer) and States

addCity(string,uint256,uint256,address,s.notice: Add a new city instanceAllows a State to add a new city giving an initial amount of PollutionTokens.It can also be used for editing purpose of the City's parameters.

addState(string,string,address,uint256,s.notice: Add a new state instanceAllows an Admin to add a new state giving an initial amount of PollutionTokens.It can also be used for editing purpose of the State's parameters.

getCityOfAState(address).notice: This will return the city belonging to a specific state that call this method

initialize(address).notice: Initialize function for the proxy upgradable pattern by OpenZeppelinInitialize variables. The address of this contract is passed to the storeContractAddress function of the ptContract, allowing this contract to call its functions

userdoc.notice: Used for CRUD operations by States and Admin
